creditline: Gift of Stephen Addiss and Audrey Yoshiko Seo
description: vertical lines of bold calligraphy characters; blue silk mounting; entire back of scroll has gold leaf decoration
marks: [日高丈五睡正濃軍將扣門驚周公口傳諫議送書信白絹斜封三道印開緘宛見諫議面首閲月團三百片聞道新年入山里
text:
Written in broad, wet, running-cursive script, the Araki Zesui’s characters are rather expansive than contained, and the mood is more indulgent than refined. 

This is the same text by Lu Tong (790–835) as that by Maki Ryo_ko_, written in clerical script.
title: Lu Tong's Tea Song
